intro: Ledebouria rietrivierensis, commonly known as the Rietrivier bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces compact, rosette-like foliage and bears clusters of white or pale pink bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. It is a perennial herb that is well adapted to Mediterranean climate conditions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
